page.title: 10Newspaper Articles.
page.content: Saturday 13 April 1985- From Farms clinging to hillsides ranging 1300ft, farmers continue reclaiming inhospit- able acres.Capital grants cuts have minimised progress meantime, denting farmers enthusiasm when depopultion is of uppermost concern,saddening those who strive to keep community spirit high. Nevertheless,self sufficiency is their aim,achieved at times against the odds. Friday 31 May -7 June- Diary of Bill Comfort,written whilst a prisoner of war,having been shot down over Germany in 1944.It is an important document of immense value forty years after World War 11. Local news pertaining to activities and personalities often appear in several local newspapers,or TV farming programmes. Not infrequently blocked roads and snowbound farms are screened
